articles.title: Oil producer Sabinal Energy divvying up Permian assets for possible sale
articles.summary: Sabinal Energy, an oil producer backed by Kayne Anderson, is preparing its Permian assets for a potential sale that could exceed $1 billion, possibly reaching $1.5 billion. The company is marketing approximately 132,000 net acres with a daily production of 13,000 barrels of oil equivalent, expected to generate over $400 million in EBITDA in the next year. This move aligns with a broader trend of consolidation in the Permian Basin and accelerated dealmaking in the shale patch as oil prices rise.

articles.title: Mean Markets? Commodities May Be a Nice Alternative.
articles.summary: The article discusses the poor performance of traditional asset classes in 2022, highlighting commodities as a potential bright spot due to their historically low correlation to other assets and their ability to act as an inflation hedge. It suggests that commodities could be a wise alternative for investors facing inflationary pressures and slower growth. Direxion offers specific ETFs (BRKY and COM) designed to capitalize on rising commodity prices and diversify portfolios.

articles.title: Southern Company knew about climate change before it funded denial
articles.summary: This report details a nearly 60-year history of Southern Company's awareness of climate change risks and its subsequent funding of climate disinformation campaigns. Despite early warnings dating back to 1964, the utility company engaged in a multi-million-dollar effort to discredit climate science, oppose emissions limits, and promote "clean coal" as a false solution. The report highlights financial contributions to various groups involved in climate denial and Southern Company's role in influencing public perception and policy.

articles.title: International Seaways Sells Stake in Al Shaheen Oil Field FSOs to Euronav
articles.summary: International Seaways has sold its 50% stake in two FSO vessels, FSO Asia and FSO Africa, to its joint venture partner Euronav NV for approximately $140 million in cash. The transaction, approved by North Oil Company, values the vessels at $300 million and secures their operation at the Al Shaheen oil field until Q3 2032 under a new ten-year contract. This move aims to strengthen International Seaways' balance sheet and support its long-term value creation strategy.
